volsense_core.data.fetch module

build_dataset(tickers: str | List[str], start: str = '2000-01-01', end: str | None = None, window: int = 15, cache_dir: str | None = None, show_progress: bool = True) → DataFrame[source]

Fetch raw OHLCV data and build a standardized volatility dataset.

Computes daily returns from adjusted close (if available, else close) and realized volatility as a rolling standard deviation over the given window, annualized by sqrt(252).

Parameters:

  • tickers (str or list[str]) – Single ticker symbol or list of tickers to include.

  • start (str) – Start date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD).

  • end (str, optional) – End date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • window (int) – Rolling window length (in trading days) used to compute realized volatility.

  • cache_dir (str, optional) – Optional directory for CSV caching during fetch.

  • show_progress (bool) – Whether to display a tqdm progress bar for multi-ticker fetches.

Raises:

ValueError – If no valid data is returned for any ticker.

Returns:

Tidy DataFrame sorted by [‘ticker’,’date’] with columns [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

fetch_ohlcv(tickers: str | List[str], start: str = '2000-01-01', end: str | None = None, show_progress: bool = True, cache_dir: str | None = None) → DataFrame | Dict[str, DataFrame][source]

Fetch OHLCV data for one or more tickers from Yahoo Finance.

Parameters:

  • tickers (str or list[str]) – Single ticker symbol or list of tickers.

  • start (str) – Start date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD).

  • end (str, optional) – End date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • show_progress (bool) – Whether to display a tqdm progress bar for multi-ticker requests.

  • cache_dir (str, optional) – Optional directory to cache each ticker’s data as CSV. If provided and a cache exists, it will be reused.

Returns:

For a single ticker, a DataFrame with columns [‘date’,’open’,’high’,’low’,’close’,’adj_close’,’volume’]. For multiple tickers, a dict mapping ticker to its DataFrame.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame or dict[str, pandas.DataFrame]
